inn1.comm: starts off with a length ball just outside off and swinging in. Allowed through to the keeper
Jamshed prods forward to defend off the front foot to this fuller length inswinging delivery
Jamshed utilises the front foot defence once again to this length ball that comes in

too full from Steyn as Nasir leans into a drive through extra-cover. The fielder inside the ring is able to run it down just in front of the extra-cover boundary, and with a quick release gets it back to the keeper to save the extra run
Steyn strikes in the first over as Nasir plays all around this fuller length ball which comes in. Finds his off stump peg knocked back as Steyn roars with approval. Didn't take long did that?
beautiful ball first up to Hafeez as this one shapes away upon pitching on a length on middle
good ball from Tsotsobe as this one shapes in on a fuller length, hitting the pads
back of a length outside off and coming in as Shehzad defends off the back foot
this one bounces appreciably after bowling on a length. Shehzad content to let it through to the keeper
classic drive off the back foot which is quickly intercepted by the point fielder inside the ring. Lovely, languid stroke that from Shehzad
shifts the line a bit too far outside off as the umpire calls a wide
full and straight on middle as Shehzad clips this to midwicket, with the batsmen in disarray as they look to complete the run. Mid-off throws at the non-strikers, but misses
punches this one solidly down the ground to the left of Tsotsobe
Steyn bowls a beautiful outswinger on middle and shaping away. Defended to the off side
Shehzad gets forward in defence to another Steyn outswinger
Steyn fires this one on a leg side line as Shehzad tries in vain to whip this off his pads
once again going down the leg side as Shehzad helps this along off his hips
gets this one on an off stump line as Hafeez drives on the up down the ground
back of a length on middle and off as Hafeez whips this off his pads to complete a quick single
Hafeez times this sweetly off his pads to hit this down to the midwicket boundary
Shehzad decides to have a go at this overpitched delivery outside off, as he looks to drive through the covers, but the ball evades his bat on its way to the keeper
once again gets this a bit too wide outside off, with the umpire calling it a wide
even better line and length from Tsotsobe as he pitches this just outside off, shaping in, and then holds it line as the batsman displays the front face
back of a length and rearing up as Shehzad defends this off the back foot
too wide and short from Tsotsobe as Shehzad helps this over the point region, beating third man to the boundary

Tsotsobe decides to test him with the short ball, and Shehzad goes for the bait as he pulls this uppishly over square leg, with McLaren running at full tilt from deep square leg to attempt a diving catch, but the ball didn't carry as far. Lucky break for Shehzad
right in the blockhole as this is defended back to the bowler
full on middle, Shehzad works it to mid wicket where Tahir fumbles, thus allowing the extra run to be taken
full from Tsotsobe as Shehzad drills this straight to silly mid-off
once again Shehzad employs the pull shot as he hits this to the leg side for one
drops this short as Hafeez goes for the pull, but can't get a meaningful connection on it
back of a length on off as Hafeez stands tall to defend this off the back foot
on a length on off, pushed to mid-on
Shehzad whips this back of a length ball off his pads behind square on the leg side
Hafeez on the back foot as he punches this off the back foot to the off side
beautiful line from Tsotsobe as he gets this one to come in on a length just outside off
full and outside off as Hafeez is content to shoulder arms
risky shot there from Hafeez as he gets forward to flick this length ball off his pads. The ball was swinging in on middle, with his pads exposed, so he is fortune to get that away
Steyn gets this to come in on the pads as Hafeez looks to play through the leg side
length ball outside off which Hafeez defends on the front foot
too full from Steyn as Hafeez waits on it before driving elegantly to extra-cover
back of a length and defended towards point
Hafeez is in two minds as he looks to play this short ball which is banged in, but instead gets the outside edge on the way to the keeper. That is his 15th dismissal to Steyn in 20 matches.
Maqsood sees off a tricky short ball to finish off the over
slower bouncer wide of off stump as Shehzad looks to pull this across the ground, but can't get it away on the leg side
Tsotsobe tries Shehzad with a short one, but this once rises appreciable over the batsman's head and keeper for five wides
follows it up with yet another wide outside off, that makes it eight wides from Tsotsobe already
back of a length and closer to the body this time as Shehzad defends to the off side
short ball just outside off as Shehzad gets tall to see this one off
crisp drive on the up through the covers, but finds mid-off
Shehzad finally finds the gap in midwicket as he pulls this slower bouncer all the way to the rope
and Shehzad unfurls a lovely drive through the covers to this length ball. Transferred the weight beautifully to find the gap between mid-off and cover
begins with a back of a length delivery on off which is pushed to the off side
this one heading down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
length ball outside off which is pushed to the off side
wide outside off, but Shehzad decides not to take the bait
this one heading down the leg side as Shehzad tries in vain to flick it away
fuller this time on the same channel as this is worked away to the leg side
works this away to the leg side for a single
played off the back foot to extra-cover
defends this time on the off side
Shehzad advances down to drive this straight to mid-off
back of a length outside off which Maqsood does well to defend
another short one from Kallis as this one zeroes in on Maqsood's groin region, but is lucky to not be in more trouble
whips this back of a length ball behind square on the leg side
this one angling down the leg side as the umpire calls a wide
slower delivery just outside off which is driven straight towards the covers
plays this back of a length ball to square leg for one
the bouncer is employed and Maqsood reacts with a pull shot of his own, but not sweetly timed off the bat
gets steep bounce on this one as it rises off a length, and at good pace, all the way to the keeper
McLaren finishes off the over strongly with another bouncer which Maqsood deflects to the off side
gets this one to pitch on middle and turn away slightly, as Shehzad looks to cut away
Shehzad unable to get this away on the off side
Shehzad waits on the back foot before Shehzad defends on the front foot
once again Shehzad moved to defend on the front foot
this time works it away to the leg side for one
good start from Tahir as he finishes off the over with Maqsood unable to get it away
this one again heading down the leg side, which Shehzad helps round the corner
length ball outside off with Maqsood getting a bottom edge which travels behind to the third man region for a boundary
and a carbon copy of the previous delivery as Maqsood again bottom-edges it to the third man region, with Tsotsobe failing to get a hand on it at the boundary
Maqsood this time defends back to the bowler
short one from McLaren, and too short as this just balloons over Maqsood's head. Called wide
ends the over with a delivery that comes in off a length
another short from McLaren, which the umpire is not amused by as he calls yet another wide
able to push this off the back foot to the leg side and it will be drinks
Maqsood defends this tentatively off the front foot
Maqsood forces this one down to long-on to get off strike
Shehzad only available to hit this towards the off side
Shehzad french cuts this behind to backward point, who is able to intercept the ball
full this time from Tahir as Shehzad gets low to try and work this away
back of a length outside off as Maqsood pushes this off the back foot towards long-on
this one rears back quite viciously on Maqsood as he looks to fend it away to the leg side. No fluency to his strokeplay at the moment
back of a length and this time he punches it towards the covers for a single
Shehzad sees this one will be a fuller length as he advances down to lean into an off side drive
Maqsood punches this off the back foot towards the off side
back of a length outside off as Shehzad cuts this away quite well
tries to drive this away on the off towards mid-off
gets on the back foot to defend to the off side
weight is on the back foot as he looks to late cut this in the gap behind square
now looks for runs on the leg side with a gentle dab
Shehzad sees the man is up at fine leg and sweeps him round the corner
drags this down to the leg side as Shehzad waits on the back foot before working this away towards midwicket
straying down the leg side and Kallis is punished with a deft glance behind for four
short of a length and rearing up as Shehzad stands tall to work this away to the leg side
fuller this time as Maqsood clips this straight to short leg. Maqsood takes a couple of steps forward, with short leg firing in the throw. Would have been gone if it hit directly.
on a length and just outside off, Maqsood cuts it straight to the fielder at point
Maqsood pushes this gently to the right of the bowler
slower ball on a length which is defended carefully to the off side
flighted on and around off as Shehzad leans into a drive through extra-cover
Maqsood tees this one off to long-on with a rather forceful shot
Shehzad able to work this away to the leg side for a single
flighted again on off as Maqsood works this away to sweeper cover
Shehzad defends this one carefully
played away to square leg, but no run is taken
back of the hand slower ball just outside off as Maqsood tries to punch this to the off side
Maqsood this time pushes to the off side, and is able to find the single
Shehzad waits on it before gliding this behind to third man for a couple
too full from Kallis as Shehzad just drills this across the ground, all the way to the extra-cover boundary
back of a length as Shehzad does the wise thing by defending off the front foot

too full from Kallis as Shehzad looks to clip through midwicket, but instead gets a thick outside edge, but with no slip region, this travels behind to the fine leg fence. Streaky shot to bring up the 50 milestone, but a four is a four
defended to the off side
this one stays low as the batsman looks to work it away
Maqsood able to power this down to long-on
Shehzad follows that up with a gentle dab down to long-off
Maqsood able to find a run square off the wicket
Shehzad finishes the over with a clip to midwicket
once again defended off the back foot
length ball which Shehzad fails to get away to the leg side
back of a length on off as Shehzad flicks square off the wicket
Maqsood looks to squirt this away to the off side, but finds the fielder
short ball which is left alone by the batsman, and wisely
short again and this time Maqsood opens the face to turn this down to third man
this one stays low on Maqood as he look so cut it away, but the ball goes under the blade
floated delivery on off, pushed to long off
flighted just outside off as Shehzad goes for the lofted shot, but gets an edge which goes behind to third man for a boundary
Shehzad able to maneuver this down to midwicket
once again trying to push off the back foot to the off side, but instead travels behind to third man
too short and wide as Maqsood is able to cut it away to the point boundary
starts off with a length ball outside off which is driven down to mid-off
back of a length on middle which is turned off the hips to the leg side. Good running from Pakistan allows them to get two as the initial dive from AB at mid-on buys them the extra
length ball which is punched back to the left of the bowler, with long-off intercepting the ball
Shehzad has had enough and decides to go aerial as this length ball is whacked over extra-cover, with the ball falling well short of the boundary
this one is short and just going down the leg side. Looks like a wide will be called, but the umpire has deemed it 'one for the over'
fuller outside off as Shehzad cuts this away through the point region for a couple
flighted delivery outside off which is cut away by Maqsood to extra-cover
with a gentle on drive he gets this down to long-on for a single
short and with width on offer, but Shehzad unable to pierce the gap in the ring
Shehzad won't die wondering as he steps down to heave this over the long-on boundary for a huge six
follows the big shot with a paddled dab to fine leg for a single
Maqsood hits this towards mid-off, and wants the single. Is sent back by Shehzad, and Duminy, running in, picks up and throws in one motion at the keeper's end, but Maqsood was in comfortably
Shehzad moves to the off side before trying to paddle sweep this down to fine leg, but short fine leg is able to intercept it
gentle dab down to long-off for a single
length ball with some width on offer as Maqsood opens the face to try and glide this down to third man, but gully is able to get a decent hand on it
fuller length delivery in the same channel as Shehzad looks to cut away, but the ball travels behind to the keeper
brings this one even closer to the body as Shehzad runs this down to third man
short from Tsotsobe as Maqsood gets on his tippy-toes to cut this away to the off side
straying down the pads as Maqsood just helps this along round the corner. The pair run hard enough to complete three. Good running that
fuller length ball just outside off which is defended manfully
another back of the hand slower ball just outside off which is defended on the front foot
fuller length this time, outside off, as Shehzad goes for the booming drive, but misses the ball as it continues on its path to the wicketkeeper
slower ball again on middle and leg which is whipped off the pads
Maqsood flicks this one behind square, but backward square leg is in complete command of it
tries to drive this back of a length delivery to long-off, but to no avail
overpitched from Tsotsobe as this drilled straight down to long-off
slower, back of a length delivery, outside off which Maqsood plays at rather awkwardly, with the ball continuing on its way to the keeper
excellent line and length there from Lopsy as Maqsood bends his back to try and ramp this over the slip region, but fails to do so
once again tests him with a shorter one as Maqsood pulls at this tentatively behind square. No control over that shot though
slower ball just outside off as Shehzad just glides this down to third man for a couple
back of a length delivery just outside off, Maqsood stands tall and punches it to deep extra cover
advances down the pitch to play a checked punch through backward point, and with enough timing, as Shehzad runs hard to get into the 80s
Shehzad now pushes this one down to mid-on, but hits it well enough to prevent the two from taking a single
angling in on middle on a yorker length as Shehzad works this down the leg side
Shehzad drives this elegantly through the extra-cover region for a single
Maqsood just eases this one down to midwicket to retrain strike for the next over

and the bowling change proves inspired as Maqsood looks to stand and deliver with a tonk down the ground to this full delivery, but instead spoons it over extra-cover, with Hashim Amla taking a safe catch. Silly shot when you consider both these batsmen had put on 124, and were looking good for many more
back of a length outside off which is defended to the off side
full this time as Misbah leans into a drive through extra-cover
bouncer which Misbah just gets a handle on
Misbah able to push this short one to the off side
length ball that Shehzad dabs down to mid-on
drifts this one on off stump as Shehzad defends on the off side
a solid drive down to long-on from Shehzad gets Misbah on strike
flighted just outside off as Misbah plays this with soft hands towards the off side
clean stroke off the back foot which allows for a single
Misbah premeditates the reverse sweep, on a line going down the leg side, and is still able to time the ball to point, with the ball bursting through the hands, all the way to the sweeper boundary
defended on the front foot to the off side
short ball on middle which is pulled behind square
Misbah able to squirt this down to third man for a single
Shehzad launches this imperiously down the ground, and with such a clean stroke, as this one goes way up high, and over the rope for six. Into the 90s now
McLaren responds with a lovely length ball just outside off which beats the outside edge
short one again and this time Shehzad chooses to evade
length ball on middle and off which is pulled by Shehzad to square leg. In complete control of that one
Shehzad leans into a lovely off drive for one
once again Misbah utilises the reverse sweep, but is unable to beat short third man to the fence
Shehzad advances down the track to push this to long-off
defended to the leg side by Misbah
Misbah thinks about going forward, but the length meant he had to adjust quickly on the back foot to get this behind square on the leg side
Shehzad waits on the back foot before driving through long-off. The pair scamper hard in order to complete two. Shehzad on 98
back of a length and Misbah gets down the track to flick this to the leg side
length ball just outside off which is defended off the back foot to silly point
Shehzad leans into a drive through the covers, but finds the fielder
Shehzad whips this back of a length ball on the pads to the leg side to get to 99
shorter one which Misbah gets on top off comfortably
tries him again with a short one, which he barely has control over, as this one lands near square leg
worked off the back foot towards the leg side
defended on the front foot by Shehzad

and with a lovely neat drive down the ground, Shehzad brings up his 3rd ODI century. He is visibly pleased as he punches the air in delight and raises his bat to the appreciation of his fans and team-mates. Needs to push on and press home the advantage for Pakistan. Timely innings this from Shehzad
Misbah happy to block this one to the leg side

Tahir strikes as Misbah, looking to glance a length delivery going down the leg side, ends up getting a soft edge on it, with de Kock doing well to move and get into position just behind to capture the rebound off the bat. Keeper and bowler are convinced they have got their man, and the umpire confirms it soon after. Scenes of joy and jubilation from the South Africans. This is a massive wicket as Misbah has been remarkably consistent this year.
Akmal defends this one rather tentatively on the front foot. Seemed to take forever to get to him
back of a length on leg as Shehzad stands tall in defence
Shehzad able to punch this down to long-on for a single. Brings back green lips on strike
gets this one to rise up as Akmal opens the face to glide this down to third man
in the slot and Shehzad obliges with a crisp drive on the up, but finds sweeper cover
back of a length and Akmal able to glance this off his hips to the leg side, playing it with soft hands

what is happening out there? Shehzad looks to ease this back of a length ball down to mid-on, but Akmal is rooted at the non-strikers, guilty of ball-watching. Shehzad is almost at the other end when he sees Tahir swoop on the ball, and is unable to make it back in time for the throw as de Kock collects it and then whips off the the bails, with Shehzad well short. What a way to shoot yourself in the foot, and Umar Akmal will be feeling guilty as the run was on, despite the risk
begins with a full one right on target, which is defended quite comfortably
Umar defends this back of a length one off the back foot, and utters a huge 'No.' About time Umar, about time...
length ball outside off which is defended straight to cover
Umar chooses to dab this down to third man for a single and get out of the hot seat. So it will be Lahla to face Steyn. Stirring stuff this
what a beauty from Steyn! Afridi hangs his bat as this one just shapes away off a length and to the keeper

this one steaming to the leg side as Afridi looks to glance behind square, but instead the ball hits the pads. The pair run two, but AB and Steyn are adamant it was out. Even the commentators have weighed in saying it just might be out.

full and just outside off as Afridi does an Afridi and looks to belt this into the next port. Instead the ball spoons up over cover, with Lopsy running behind, but unable to get into it, and it was just a couple of yards away
see, this is how you do it. Similar delivery as the one to Afridi, except this time Umar fetches a four with a crisp cover drive that leaves the fielders frozen in their stance
width offered and Umar looks to cut this away behind point, but finds the fielder
low full toss on off which is driven straight to mid-off
back of a length and Umar able to pull this into the ground on the off side for what in the end is a safe shot
plays this one nicely to deep midwicket without much incident. Which is saying a lot as there is rarely not an incident with Afridi on strike
bang on middle on a length, defended back to the bowler
on the same channel and this time Afridi is able to successfully whip it away
slow bouncer outside off as Umar looks to pull this to the top tier, but the bat beat the ball to the punch
with the most delicate of late cuts Akmal is able to steer this behind to third man for a single
bouncer outside off and Afridi glides this down to third man for one

Umar looking to be cute by just edging this behind to third man, but misses the ball, with the ball just shaving the off stump. The keeper must have been surprised it didn't hit the bat or timber as he spills the take, with the batsmen running one. Not called a bye so must have hit the edge
McLaren fires this one on in just outside off, as Umar french cuts behind to fine leg
low full toss just outside off as Afridi works this away to deep square leg
stand and deliver from Umar as this short and wide delivery is dealt with handsomely as he goes up and over third man for a huge six
full length delivery which is eked out to point
bouncer this time from McLaren and Afridi knows the leg side field as he pulls this behind square into the vacant gap for a boundary
bouncer which is deemed wide by the umpire, as this was swinging down the leg side
length ball just outside off as Afridi plays this with soft hands, allowing the pair to run a risky single. McLaren runs with Umar, and kicks the ball towards the striker's stumps, but misses
back of a length outside off and shaping away, beating the bat on the way to the keeper
full and shaping away as Afridi is able to cover the line and work this away to the leg side
full and swinging away as Umar lofts this classically down the ground for four
little shorter from Steyn as Umar pulls this away to the leg side

wide outside off and Afridi, looking to guide this past the slips, instead guides it to the slip, with Steyn over the moon. Only reason this could be construed a big wicket is if he let loose in the end overs, which he is capable off. But South Africa have remedied that prospect quite well
full length ball which is defended to the off side
Umar flashes hard at this wide delivery outside off, with Lopsy doing well at third man to cut off the boundary
length ball coming in this time as Bhatti defends off the back foot
play and a miss from Bhatti. Umar asking him to not get rooted and look for an opportunity to rotate the strike
back of a length and shaping down the leg side as Bilawal is able to find the gap between square for two runs
played to point for a single, giving Umar the final ball of the over
fires in a yorker which nullifies any scoring option for Umar, as Bilawal will have to front up for the next over. Umar looking slightly dejected as he realises this
full length ball outside off which is just blitzed through the covers for a fine boundary. Emphatic shot that from Bilawal. Wonder why Umar was do dissauded? The lad can bat!
short and wide and a glorious scoring opportunity missed as Bilawal fails to get this away with a cut shot
right in the blockhole as Umar just gets a bat on it, but the pair are unable to get a single from it. Tremendous yorker that from McLaren
once again on the money as Umar french cuts this behind to fine leg for a single
and make that three out of three as Bilawal gets his bat down to eke out a single
yorker again, but the line is wrong, as Umar is able to time this through the gap in point. Hits this just late enough for it to race to the boundary
Bilawal is unable to get this length ball, with late away swing, away to the off side
how about that? Bilawal steps to the leg side and gets low to hammer this full length delivery straight down to long-off
Bilawal where have you been? He gives himself room and pulls this in front of square, and with control, through the gap at midwicket. Excellent stuff
this time Steyn fires it wide of off stump, and at yorker length, but Bhatti get it away
Bhatti doesn't care for reputations as he flat bats Steyn over mid-off to the fence. Didn't time this at all, but hit it powerfully enough to escape the clutches of a diving mid-of

but it is Steyn who has the last laugh as Bhatti, looking to mow one down the ground, instead gets a thick outside edge which carries behind to the keeper. Muted celebrations from South Africa though as they need to keep a check on the scoring, which has gotten out of their hands in the recent overs
Kallis tests Umar with a slower delivery outside off, which Umar glides down to short third man
full delivery just outside off as this is powered down to long-off
Umar gets under this fuller length ball and hits it inside-out with such panache that it just sails over the sweeper cover boundary for six. What a shot that from Umar!
and he follows that up with a gentle push to the off side for one
Umar swivels to pull a short one going down the leg side to fine leg
Anwar Ali not at all in control of this hook shot as Kallis fires in another short one, which goes all the way to the fine leg boundary
Steyn's over starts with a boundary as a streaky edge goes all the way to the third man fence
low full toss which Umar hits down to mid-on

another huge play and miss by Anwar, but they are able to run the bye. Steyn complains about Anwar running on the pitch, but on second glance it may just be that he was appealing for obstruction of the field, as de Kock's throw was blocked when Anwar had changed direction, with the ball hitting his left shoulder. Anwar must have seen it out of his peripheral vision as he changes direction slightly to get in the way. The umpire has deemed it to be out. Been a while since I saw a dismissal in this manner

and just as I finish typing that last explanation, Steyn has got Umar Akmal to edge a full delivery outside off to the keeper. Third umpire has been called on to deliberate, and the final decision is that it is out. There was definitely a sound as it hit the face of the bat. That is five wickets for Steyn as well, but as usual, he has got a grumpy look on his face.
full and just outside off as Junaid drives this down to mid-on
and Steyn finishes the innings with six wickets as Ajmal, looking to hit this to the leg side, instead gets a top-edge which flies directly behind to third man, who completes the take

inn2.comm: full and just outside off as Amla pushes this gently to the off side
Amla gets on his toes to defend this off the back foot
Amla content to allow this one through to the keeper
Amla once again solid in defence to this back of a length ball outside off
brings this one in a bit closer as Amla plays this with a straight bat towards the third man region. The pair able to complete a run
Smith able to work this one to the leg side, but for no runs. Good opening over from Junaid to set the tone
Amla content to leave this one alone as it is pitched on a length, wide of off stump
pitches this up a bit fuller as Amla drives this into the ground and straight to cover
back of a length outside off which Amla defends off the back foot
good length ball outside off which is defended to the off side
back of a length and Amla just deflects this to the off side
back of a length and Amla tries to whip this off his pads
Smith whips this off his pads to midwicket for a single
this one pitching outside edge leg and coming in as Junaid goes up for the appeal. He is convinced, but this was still outside the line
beautiful line from Junaid which is defended off the back foot
back of a length and defended back to the bowler. Sharp stuff from Junaid
Amla dabs this back of a length ball down to third man to get off strike
Smith tries to push this off stump delivery to the leg side in his own inimitable style, but can't find the gap
Amla drives this length ball straight to mid-off, but can't buy a run at the moment
Anwar Ali on point with another length ball on the off stump channel
but then gets it wrong as he pitches this wide outside off, with Amla flashing hard to cut this in front of square to register the first South African boundary
Amla plays this back of a length ball with soft hands to mid-off, and is able to complete the run
Smith tries to dab this one down through third man, but hits it straight to slip
Smith once again looking to play an off side delivery to the leg side, but finds mid-on
Amla able to play this one away to midwicket
Smith once again trying to play to the leg side

and that is that. The first shot which Smith attempts to play to the off side, and he gets an edge as it carries through to Umar Akmal. First wicket down and Pakistan look to be on top in these opening exchanges
coming in on a length as de Kock sees off his first delivery successfully
back of a length and coming in as de Kock is able to negotiate it off the back foot
similar line and length and it meets with the same result as de Kock defends to the leg side off the back foot
fantastic delivery there from Anwar Ali as this one just beats the outside edge on the way to the keeper
this time Amla plays a back of a length ball onto his body. Played this one a bit too early
full and just outside off as Amla leans into a straight drive which is intercepted successfully by mid-on
back of a length delivery which is defended to the bowler
in the slot and de Kock obliges with a somewhat timed drive square off the wicket, which finds the gap between point and cover, all the way to the rope
de Kock pulls this back of a length delivery straight to mid-on, running hard to complete the single
Junaid continues his excellent line and length as de Kock has no answer but to defend off the back foot
full and on middle as de Kock drives this straight to mid-off

this time Junaid drops it short as de Kock gets early into his shot, with the ball hitting his midsection. A bit of bad blood there between the keeper-batsman and the bowler as the former pushes Junaid away
bowls it on the same channel and slightly fuller. De Kock unable to get it away

length ball outside off which is driven straight back at Junaid, who does well to block the shot from going past him. Pakistan fielders are pumping him up as he is certainly in the zone and has found a good rhythm
gets the line wrong on this one as he bowls it too full and wide, with de Kock jumping on this as he times this beautifully in the gap at extra-cover
back of a length outside off as Amla has a swat at it, but finds cover
full length delivery which is eased down to midwicket for one
in the slot once again but de Kock is unable to get this away as he hits it directly to mid-off
de Kock leans forward to clip this off his pads to the leg side
Amla able to work this away to mid-off for a single. Amla slowly getting into gear here

slower ball on middle and leg as de Kock plays this one with soft hands, and immediately sets off for a quick single. The throw is fired in, but Anwar Ali unable to get a grasp on it to run out the non-striker
drifts this in on a length, and is respected by de Kock with a display of his front foot defence
de Kock looking to nudge this in the gap on the off side with soft hands, but can't penetrate
drags this one a bit short as it allows de Kock to rock back and flay this to the leg side
this one is played to deep midwicket for a gentle single
lovely line here from Ajmal as de Kock gets forward in defence
shortish length from Ajmal as de Kock gets on the back foot to push this down to mid-on
up in the slot and de Kock hits it towards sweeper cover
slower ball this time, just outside off, as Amla is able to steer this behind square for one
fires in a short ball which is pulled handsomely to deep midwicket
Amla solid in defence to this back of a length delivery from Anwar
Amla fails to get away this shorter one to the leg side for runs
Amla happy to clip this length ball off the pads down to square leg
drifts this on a length, defended back to the bowler
slightly shorter this time as this one holds up in the air after Amla plays it to the leg side
de Kock able to cover the line and ease this down to midwicket for one
Amla slides down to whip this off his pads to the leg side
de Kock looking to play this round the corner, but finds backward point
de Kock steps down to drive this through the covers

full and just outside off as de Kock, looking to mow this down over long-on, gets a top-edge which flies to Bhatti at deep fine leg, who is too deep as he runs in, but messes up the front-ward dive, with the ball bouncing before
Amla just helps this round the corner to the same region for a quick single
length ball on leg which is hit straight to mid-on
de Kock flicks this one on the top of its bounce to the leg side. The pair run well enough to make it three runs, which is appreciated by the home crowd
back of a length as Amla steers this one down to third man for a single
de Kock tries to cut away a short of a length ball behind square, but succeeds in only hitting it into the ground just ahead of him

huge shout from Hafeez as Amla plays this one late, with the ball, originally pitching outside off, turning in to hit the front pad. Hafeez was ready to demand for it, but Misbah told him to hold on, and consulted with the keeper, before deciding to review it. Currently waiting on a decision. And the final verdict is that it is not-out as it had pitched outside line
Amla handles the next delivery without much issue
full on middle as Amla looks to play this square on the leg side
drops this one slightly short as Amla gets on the back foot to punch this through the off side, with such timing and precision, that it screams across the surface to the rope
smart batting from Amla as he just eases this one down to midwicket for one
de Kock ends up defending this back to the bowler to cap off an eventful over for both sides
low full toss outside off to help him steady the nerves as he bowls to one of the premier batsmen in this format

right in the zone and Amla is too good a batsman to not put these away as Bhatti's inexperience comes to the fore. Just filets this beautifully through the line in the vacant gap between long-off and extra-cover
Bilawal answers with a well-timed short one which Amla is unable to get a bat on. Bhatti stares him down in his follow-through. Game on

length ball and coming in as this one strikes Amla on the front pad, and then ricochets behind to third man, with the pair running a bye. Bhatti has a shout, but it is quickly stymied by his team-mates
de Kock able to play this directly into the covers for a single
back of a length and slanting in as Amla defends to the leg side
full on off, pushed softly to cover
worked away to deep mid wicket with uber calmness
de Kock overbalances as he looks for the drive, missing the ball completely. Umar takes the ball and stumps him, but he was behind the line, so all is well
de Kock plays a short-arm pull to midwicket
Amla content to push this one down to deep midwicket
de Kock ambles down the track, but the ball turns away at the last moment as he just gets this away to the off side for a hastily-run single
full and on the money as de Kock just helps this along to deep fine leg
back of a length and coming in as Amla is solid in defence
shortish length ball which de Kock tucks away to the leg side. Played that one with soft hands. The shot also brings up the fifty partnership between this pair
Amla hops as he pulls this short delivery to deep midwicket

fires in a short one and de Kock decides to go for it as he hits this through fine leg, but with little control, as it travels over deep fine leg, who is backing to the rope, but can't get a hand to it
short again from Bhatti and he is not getting it as de Kock swivels in his spot to pull this magnificently to the square leg boundary
Amla brings down the straightest of bats to see off this first delivery
Amla, with a gentle push to the leg side, gets off strike
just drags this one a bit as de Kock is able to tuck this away to the leg side

becoming a little too easy for South Africa as a back of a length delivery is glanced to the leg side. Afridi, coming in from backward point, fires one in at the striker's end, with the ball bouncing and hitting Umar Akmal on the knee, who stumbles as he calls for the third umpire, uttering a very pained howzat
tossed up delivery outside off, Amla gets forward and defends it
this one is played with ease to midwicket
quicker one on middle which is defended to the leg side
de Kock plays this one with soft hands to mid-off, and is able to make his ground after the throw hits the stumps at the non-strikers
Amla looking to shuffle in his crease to create space, but ends up hitting this towards the off side for none
Amla misses out on a slightly wider one outside off, looking to cut this away
Amla plays this one to the leg side for none
back of a length and heading towards the leg stump as Amla backs away slightly to punch this to the off side in order to retain strike for the next over
Amla just clips this fuller length delivery to deep square leg
de Kock looking to flick this to the leg side. Some hesitation there as de Kock is not sure if there is a run, but Amla is barreling down to the other end. Able to beat a throw from the fielder
Amla has had enough of this dibbly-dobbly batting and goes down to loft this classically over long-off, with a one-bounce four
Amla proceeds to take a single off the next ball with a dab down to long-on
de Kock content to steer this down to deep midwicket for a single
Amla gets deep into his crease to defend this one to the leg side
de Kock steers this one down to long-on for an easy single
quicker one this time as Amla fails to pierce a gap in the inner ring
Amla on the back foot to punch this to the off side
slower through the air, de Kock lofts it to long off, he didn't get it off the meat of the bat and gets only a couple
lovely, flighted delivery on middle and off, and defended to the front foot
de Kock able to play this down to third man for a couple
plays this one to deep midwicket with the turn
back of a length and cut away to point by de Kock
Amla able to flick this full length ball straight to square leg, who is inside the ring
Amla straight-drives this one right past the bowler
back of a length and clipped away to the leg side
back of a length and dabbed down to long-on for an easy single
Amla able to drive this down to long-on. The pair are batting beautifully at the moment
de Kock trying to be cute with a reverse sweep, but the turn beats him as it hits the pad. Stifled appeal from Pakistan, but that was never a shout
Amla gets back to whip this one off the pads to square leg

and Afridi gets his man! De Kock comes down the wicket to clip this length ball over midwicket, but instead hits it directly to silly mid-on. Huge smiles across Misbah and Afridi's faces. Big wicket there as it was against the run of play and they were threatening to take this game away from Pakistan entirely. Fine knock from de Kock nonetheless
defends the first offering on the front foot with skill
almost gives it away the next ball as he looks to loft this over midwicket, with the ball just going over the fielder's head
fullish delivery on the pads, Amla clips it to midwicket
Amla able to whip this one off his pads quite easily
Kallis gets on the back foot to try and nudge this through the leg side
Kallis opens the face to steer this down to point
Amla deep in his crease to play this away to the leg side
this one holds up on Amla as he looks to extend his arms to chip this down to long-on
fuller length ball driven skillfully by Amla to sweeper cover
Kallis happy to defend this one to the off side
Kallis looks to drive this down to long-off, but Afridi is in the way
this time angles his bat to get this one down to long-on
Amla punches this one to silly mid-off
Amla once again looks for the drive down to long-off, which he does successfully. On 49 now
Amla steers this one gently to point to register his 22nd ODI fifty, and 4th against Pakistan
Kallis able to work this one round the corner to fine leg
Amla looking to late cut this, but instead gets a thick outside edge which goes directly behind, evading the gloves of Umar Akmal, on the way to the rope
Amla able to work this one away to the off side for a single
gets his line wrong completely as this one heads down the leg side for extras
Kallis just tucks this away to the leg side for an easy single
Amla plays a lovely, wristy punch off the back foot through the extra-cover region
back of a length and staying low as Amla just works this away to long-off
Kallis looking for the booming drive, but hits it quite feebly to silly mid-off
rushes Kallis with this quicker one as he tries to play off the back foot
Kallis, looking to sweep, instead gets a top edge which goes straight up. There are four fielders around it, but Ajmal calls it, and Ajmal takes it. Kallis gone for 6, and South Africa now 117 for 3
Amla just drives this one down to silly mid-off
and de Villiers gets straight off the mark with a sweetly timed square drive on the off side
de Villiers looking for the drive on the up through the leg side, but doesn't get a good connection on it
AB shimmies down the track to drive on the up through the off side
back of a length again as Amla runs this one down to third man
Bhatti unleashes the bouncer next, but this is far too short as the umpire calls it a wide
back of a length outside off which is punched straight to silly mid-off. Slightly uppish that last stroke
AB dances down and sends this length delivery straight to the extra-cover boundary. Splendid shot!
slower one outside off which AB opens the face to, to get to third man
back of a length and pushed to the leg side
back of a length ball which is cut away through the point region
Amla drives this one straight down to silly mid-off
Amla waits on the back foot before cutting this away square on the off side. Amla ran the first one hard, and is able to come back for two
Amla punches this one straight to extra-cover for an easy single
back of a length and tucked away to the leg side. A misfield from mid-on allows the extra run
AB able to glance this one off the pads behind square on the leg side
this one was short and heading to the leg side as AB pulls this towards the gap between fine and square leg, with square leg doing well to dive before the rope and fire in a throw
Bhatti what exactly are you trying here? another short ball, even shorter than the previous one, as this one is immediately called wide by the umpire

back of a length as AB lurches forward to punch this towards mid-off. Anwar Ali, probably all excited about how he had bowled earlier, sends in a throw at the non-strikers, but the keeper is not behind it, as the ball carries all the way to the fine leg boundary for extras
Amla hops as he glances this behind square for one
AB finds the gap on the off side with a sweetly timed punch through extra-cover
full delivery on middle and off which is defended to the off side by Amla
quicker one on middle and leg which is directed straight to short leg
AB forces this one down to long-on as he manipulates his position effectively
Amla drives this one authoritatively to long-off
back of a length, allowing AB to free up his arms to guide this through to extra-cover
a little flight offered from Afridi as Amla drives this one straight to silly mid-off
Amla able to drive this one down to long-off to complete the over
Amla gets back to try and work this off the pads, but some splendid fielding cuts off any intentions for a run
once again tries to work the gap on the leg side
Amla struggling to pierce the gaps as he hits this one directly to square leg
back of a length and Amla this time is able to play it softly enough to create enough space for him to run a signal and get to the other end
AB shuffles down and works this towards square leg
fired in on middle and leg as Amla is able to play this one down the ground for one
length ball which is whipped off the pads behind square
that one skids off the track, AB de Villiers hurriedly defends it off the back foot
back of a length and punched to the off side
Amla steers this one in the gap in the inner ring for a single
AB positions himself to flay this away to the off side for one
Amla drives this one down to long-off
back of a length as Amla steps down to work this to long-on
AB gets deep in the crease to try and pierce the gap on the leg side
once again AB steps down and this time is able to nurdle the gap
Amla on the back foot to work this one round the corner for a quick single
AB competently works this one down the ground to long-on
Amla finishes off the over by playing it straight back to Hafeez
this one a bit short as AB gets on the back foot to cut this away to extra-cover
AB steers this fuller length ball down to long-on for a single
Amla looks to play this one inside-out through the covers, but finds the fielder
Amla waits patiently on the back foot before cutting away in front of square
AB into position quickly to punch this through the covers for one
Amla again playing inside-out as he gets this towards mid-off. The pair are able to scamper for a single
Amla just works this one down to long-on to get off the strike. Fifty up for these two
AB flicks this one away towards square leg
Amla waits on the back foot before turning this one round the corner for one
AB decides to press the accelerator as he advances down before hitting this cleanly over long-on for a six
AB steps back to cut this away through the gap at extra-cover. Excellent batting this
AB then takes the single to the leg side to keep strike for the next over
gets his line wrong completely as AB sees the opportunity to step inside the line on leg stump and then paddle this past short fine leg to the boundary
AB rushes too quickly into his shot as Ajmal flights another one, which hits him on the body. Bye is given
Amla plays this one with soft hands towards a tightly-packed off side

what a way to get to your half-century! he just waits on this Ajmal delivery, and then, at the right moment, quickly pulls this fiercely to the square leg boundary, and hits it so powerfully that it has gone out of the ground. Not much Pakistan could do when AB is in this kind of mood
AB thinks about a shot through the off side, but instead plays it back to the bowler
once again the wrong line and Ajmal is not doing any service for his captain as AB obliges with a manufactured paddle that beats short backward square leg to the boundary
and he is greeted with a four through third man as Amla places this back of a length ball efficiently through the gap
back of a length and punched straight to mid-off
once again Amla runs this down to third man for an easy single. The crowd seem convinced the match is all but over as the national anthem holds strong in the air

short one this time from Junaid, which surprises AB as he looks for the pull, but the ball balloons back to third man. With three fielders converging on it, none of them are even able to make a dive for it, as this lands safely in between

Amla times this so sweetly that what seemed a mere push through point, almost beat third man to the fence. Between AB and Amla, it must be tough to be a Pakistani bowler? Along with the slipshod fielding on display
once again Amla is content to dab this down to third man. South Africa truly well ahead now
pitches closer to the body, but Amla still manages to open the face to run this down to third man
Amla shuffles in his crease before resorting to his trusted paddle sweep over fine leg. Another boundary and the crowd roar into song once again
AB lasers this one straight to mid-off. Amla wanted the run but was sent back in quick time
short and going down the leg side as AB helps it along with another improvised paddle which finds the fine leg boundary. SA simply racing to the target now
AB is having a whale of a time as he dances down to pull this through midwicket, where there are no fielders. Pakistan looking increasingly dejected out there on the field
with a flamingo-like followthrough, AB is able to pull this one towards square leg for a single, and more importantly for SA fans, retain strike for the next over
AB is looking imperious. He just blasts this one through extra-cover, and was hit at such a rate of knots that the fielders were left in their places

AB gets down on one knee and pays homage to Brendon McCullum as he is able to paddle this off Junaid's pace, with one knee bent, over fine leg for another boundary. This powerplay has proven to be the difference between both sides
I honestly thought AB would grace us with another shot out of nowhere, but instead, blitzes this one straight to mid-off

and de Villiers perishes in the only way it seemed possible as he goes for another fancy, one-knee-on-the-ground, paddle flick, that is hit much higher than it goes farther. Gets this one too square though as Afridi, at deep square leg, is able to hold on to the chance. The crowd is subdued as the South African captain walks back to the pavilion with a brilliant 45-ball 74
Amla waits on the back foot before glancing this behind to the leg side
JP shows off his back foot defence, in case the Port Elizabeth crowd had forgotten what it looked like
short and turning into the pads, Amla works it to backward square leg
JP looking for the gap in the inner ring with a back foot punch, but finds the fielder
JP able to tuck one away to the leg side to bring Amla back on strike
Amla plays this one with the softest of hands as Bhatti makes a fumble at point, allowing the run to be taken without much discomfort
JP plays this one into the gap on the off side and runs immediately to the other end for one
Amla looking for the gap on the off side, but finds the fielder
back of a length and rising as JP punches this off the back foot through the point region
Amla drives this one straight to long-on, and runs hard. The throw hits the non-strikers, but he was in
JP tries again off the back foot to pierce the gap at point
going down the pads as JP is able to flick this round the corner for a quick-ran two
short ball and Duminy pulls this one behind square. Square leg able to recover and throw it back to the keeper
Amla looking for the gap in midwicket, but instead hits it to the fielder
JP gets forward in defence, with the ball inside-edging between his legs, as the pair run a single
Amla waits patiently on the back foot, before attempting a wristy flick through the leg side
Amla able to penetrate the gap in the covers by backing away outside leg and cutting into the ground on the off side
Ajmal fires this one down the leg side, with Amla helping it along to fine leg
JP trying to create room to play this to the leg side, but instead hits it back to the bowler
JP going for the lofted shot through long-off, but the ball spins away just enough to beat the edge
Amla pulls this one to square leg for a quick single
JP steps down to steer this to long-on for a single

back of a length and Amla looking to flat bat this past Junaid. Hits this directly onto Junaid's shin bone, who goes down like a house of cards on the pitch. The physio and back room staff have raced across the field to tend to the left-armer. Out comes the special spray
swings this in on the pads as JP goes for the big hit, but misses

Junaid fires in a 143 kph missile, and JP plays the deftest of paddle sweeps, so straight it could have gone into the keeper's hands, as this one races along the turf to the fence. Outrageous shot that!
and Junaid finishes with a widish delivery outside off which JP hits over short third man, but is reined in by third man near the boundary
Amla happy to tuck this away to the leg side for a single
once again goes for the big swing, but misses. This one almost hit the off stump behind, being just a few inches away
JP uses his feet to get down the track and drill this straight to long-off
follows Amla as he looks to create space on the off side, but is unable to do anything more than to chop onto his stumps
once again Amla tries to get this away, but can't find the space

Amla looking to get to his milestone with a six over square leg, instead hits it directly up, with Mohammad Hafeez taking a difficult one to end what has been a top innings from the opener. Threatened to carry his bat through the innings, and his 98 has gone a long way in setting this up for South Africa
and Miller begins with a wild swipe through the off side, with the ball carrying behind to third man

JP is gone! looking to seal this match sooner than later as he looks to pull one through midwicket, and hits it sweet enough for Anwar Ali, stationed at deep midwicket, to run forward and take the catch. Can South Africa do it? 8 needed off 4. This game is not over just yet
excellent ball as this one spears in on middle and leg, hitting Miller's foot/base of the pad. The pair look for a run but Junaid runs in to recover the ball, quashing that notion
full and straight and all Miller can do is blitz this straight to mid-off, who holds on to it

another beauty from Junaid as he fires this in on middle and leg. He is staying calm under immense pressure when his team needs him most. Only one run allowed, which is understandable given the state of play

would you believe it! can you believe it! Pakistan have clinched this! Junaid fires in another brutal yorker, that misses everything, but goes between Miller's leg as he looks to make room to get under this. The ball might have carried behind all the way to the boundary for runs, but Pakistan still win by just a solitary run. Possibly revenge for when South Africa pulled the rug from under Pakistan's feet in UAE when Pakistan seemingly were rolling to victory, before quick wickets made them lose that encounter by 1 run as well. Amazing stuff this. Has been a fantastic encounter to take hold off.
